newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures tumble on bearish technicals.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures tumble on bearish technicals.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures plunged 435 points by the close of Thursday's trade as a weak technical outlook reinforced overall bearish sentiment and triggered a fierce sell-off, dealers said.
Stop-loss sales were triggered on the move down causing the benchmark Nikkei 225 March contract to finish just 50 points above a year low of 19,600. Volume was a moderate 20,500 lots.
The 225-share Nikkei average fell 522.36 points to close at a low for the year of 19,570.67.

"It held above 19,950 till about 1:00 p.m. (0500 GMT). Then people came back from lunch and found the technical pattern confirmed a down move so they just sold it off," said a dealer with a local institution.
"The move down was so fast that it took out the (previous year low) of 19,610 that we saw on the June contract," he added.
He said it would take a while for the market to bounce back as there was significant volume behind the drop.

"The first resistance is at 19,950 but that's 300 points away and it's going to be a tough climb," he said. "Any kind of bounce will invite some selling because now (the trend) is no longer sideways to down. It's just down."
On the downside, a move below support at 19,550 could expose the March Nikkei to a potentially steep fall below 18,000.
